page.title: 14ASSESSMENT CENTRE
page.content: Forhill House is a small pocket of Kings Norton Parish administered by B'ham City Council.The house & grounds provide a beautiful view of the countryside, not always enjoyed by those offenders who are city boys.It is a large rambling Victorian house with many later additions, surrounded by outbuildings adapted as workshops. A staff of 40 teach and care for off- enders during their stay.The Centre caters for boys aged 15-21 for a min- imum period of 3 weeks assessment.Some offenders stay a maximum of 9 months. The teaching staff prefer longer than 3 weeks to assess the boys' suitabil- ities for training & to get to know personalities.Although Forhill is a secure house there are opportunities for physical outlets in the garden, workshops & sports hall.{Silvermead}
